main event: Multiple sightings of flaming objects reported by several Air Force groups and ground observers in the Yukon, Canada, and Alaska area on March 5, 1953.
interesting points: Several objects were observed appearing and disappearing in short durations,The objects were described as flaming and brilliant,Observed at various locations by both mobile persons and aircraft,The dimensions of the objects were estimated to be about 1-2 miles in diameter, Dr. C.P. Olivier evaluated the incident and suggested a possible astronomical explanation as a meteor.
witness description: Air Force groups and ground observers
